Reviews.Content: It's like a Third World Dive I have stayed in dives in third world countries but this dump defies all standards. When I arrived, a bolshy receptionist would not accept my voucher, which was a print out to confirm payment. She demanded proof of payment and when I said that I didn't usually walk around Amsterdam with my credit card statement, became even more obstructive. We argued and said that I wanted to see the manager and complain - and only then would she check me in.The room was a garret in the eves, it smelt, and the bathroom stank, with a deep sewage, drainy smell, with a dirty shower which obviously had not been cleaned since the last guest had checked out. I asked them politiely to clean it but to no avail. One evening I returned to my room only to find it bare - they had removed all my belongings to another room without telling me - so I still had my laptop in the safe and had to go and redeem it. This happened on 2 occasions. I heard mice scurrying in my room, but was too depressed to do anything about it, the fire alarm which was just out side my room went off in the middle of the night...I had several sleepless nights in this dive and it might be cheap, but it's a false economy. Pay a bit more and stay away from the Damrak street!
Reviews.Author: Deeli

Reviews.Content: Death trap staris There were 4 of us on the trip, we initially went into the Damrak hotel but were then told to go further down the street. We went in the tiny door and struggled up the stairs with our suitcases. There were 20 thin copper pipes stuck under the carpet and clipped to the banister going up the stairs and how we didn't get impaled on them is astonishing. They tried to charge us when we checked in despite having already paid.There was a mouse in the room and if that didn't keep us awake it was the other guests having arguments at reception all night long.The night porter was incredibly grumpy, the room was tiny with 2 single beds and bunk beds and very little room to leave our luggage we were constantly clambering over the beds or suitcases. We were told we had to walk down the street for breakfast but the place looked quite grotty so we didn't bother. The one good thing is the place is very central and easy to get to the problems start when you go in the door...
Reviews.Author: fifi86

Reviews.Content: Very pleased as I was dreading going after reading the reviews! After reading some of the reviews on this website I was not looking forward to stopping in this hotel. When we arrived and checked into our room we were very suprised. The room wasn't huge but was clean and basic and looked like the room on the pictures on the hotel website. Yes it isn't one of the best hotels but for the price you pay and the location it is in you cannot expect to be in a five star hotel. The only problem we had was that the bathroom was on the hallway so not very personal but after reading the reviews about mice, I couldn't complain about that. Yes the stairs are steep but that is typical of Amsterdam,  I cannot comment about the safe or possessions going missing as I must admit I never use hotel safes and always carry anything valuable with me.  I don't know what the breakfast was like as we didn't wake up early enough to go and try it :-) I would stop here again as it is in a fantastic location and perfect if you spend most of your time out and about and don't want to pay a lot of money just for somewhere to sleep and shower!With this being one of the rare good reviews about this hotel, maybe we were lucky and had one of the nicest rooms?
Reviews.Author: Vic-UK-88

Reviews.Content: dont go here Well dont no were to start ,had no heating was very cold. They took payment for stay before we even put bags into room [ should have known ] on their site it had breakfast included but did not say that u have to go out and down the street to a different place could not find it staff were a joke did not care oh and they even charged me more then what was on comformation email the check of them i highly would not recomend this place only 1 thing good it was clean.
Reviews.Author: TRACYASHDAN

Reviews.Content: BED BUGS! I have just got back from 3 nights at the damrak Inn. The hotel itself is ok - basic but that's what you expect for a 2 star hotel. HOWEVER - everyone in my group is covered in bites. Strongly believe them to be from bed bugs. Not nice at all. My hand is twice the size it should be and is very painful and my friends ankles are also swollen. I have 3 bites on my face (one on my eyelid) The rooms are dirty and cramped and the stairs are a nightmare. I look and feel like the elephant woman. 5 of us covered in sore bites. GRIM!
Reviews.Author: whitejax

Reviews.Content: Terrible experience... I stayed one night at the Damrak Inn and it was the worst hotel I've ever been to...I had a lot of luggage, and the room was on the 4th floor...Needless to say, there was no lift, and the stairs were so narrow, I could barely walk. The single room was very, very small and I could not sleep the whole night due to some noisy tourists in the next room. The guests were quite loud, and the whole thing appeared out of control. I will never stay there again!
Reviews.Author: pstadnick

Reviews.Content: Disaster Do not trust what you see on pictures! this hotel is very very small!! you even feel embarresed just to go in the front door! rooms are tiny and there is no elevator you have to carry the luggage to your room with small and steep stairs! nobody even tries to help you to carry your luggage from the staff. and for this kind of hotel i think its overpriced only stayed here for 1 night and did our 3 remaning nights in amsterdam at the tulipp inn amsterdam centre, just round the block from this hotel for the same price, and it is a 3 star hotel and this was also in the centre of amsterdan and a deluxe room!
Reviews.Author: IanZahn

Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! Mice! We booked 2 twin rooms in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is tiny, the stairs are practically vertical and there is no lift. Our rooms were on the 5th floor of the building.The rooms seemed adequate at first....in line with what you would expect from a 2 star hotel. There were no towels in our rooms though and there were workmen in our rooms on arrival which the reception staff failed to mention. MICE:One of our party went for a nap in one of the rooms and noticed the sound of mice scratching in the room! We advised the reception staff member who admitted that they have a mouse problem but that they had bought poison in from Belgium which would kill them within 10 minutes of consuming it! Comforting!! We were not offered another room as the hotel was full and there was no satisfaction given. Eventually we went back to the reception to complain that we wanted to leave and we wanted a refund....the person on the desk just handed us a complaint form to fill in and said the manager would be there in the morning! We later found out that he was the manager!!! That night 3 of us slept in 2 single beds pushed together in the room without the mice! The next morning we went back to the reception to sort it out. After some lengthy negotiations the general manager came to the hotel and refunded us. We still had to pay for the 1 room that we stayed in though which I think should have been refunded also given the circumstances. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. We later got a much nicer hotel for the same money...and it had a lift!! (And no mice!)
Reviews.Author: AoifeW

Reviews.Content: Never Again....... Great location situated on Damrak close to central station and all landmarks.Above a chip shop....smell.In-undated with mice everywhere-unpleasant.Tony and Mark (receptionists) were scared of them!!!Strange smells around....get my gist.What more can I say..... Would not recommend it although staff very friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: MIGHTYMOUSECornwall

Reviews.Content: Don't Stay Here If You Value Your Money  The frst couple of nights stay we thought this hotel was great..perfect location  the room was nice enough for a base to get ready in  sleep! Until returning to our room on the Sat afternoon to discover money had been stolen  put a dampner on our stay!I Here are my complaints overall!!!Firstly the room was far too hot! We were in a quad room with a radiator that was on constantly at 5 even when you turned it to zero!!! You woke up feeling like you were in spain with no air con! We complained about this to the staff but nothing was done! We had to have our window fully open all the time! This was pretty unsafe as there was a bar missing from the outside so if you stumbled you would be lying on the pavement below!Secondly we had money stolen from the room which we reported  the staff did not seem to concerened  said they would pass it on to the mananger! This made us angry but not much we could do about it! I was asked to fill out a complaint form which I did but it also asked for my bank details!! Why on earth would they need that I thought?!Thirdly the cleaner rummages through your case  belongings which I now realise he was probably looking for more money!Since returning home I read the other bad reviews regarding money being stolen etc  that all the hotel staff are in on the SCAM...to be honest I quite believe!!! These reviews were left just the day before we left..If only I had check this site again then and seen those we would prob gone elsewhere or been more carefull  taken our money with us! THEY EVEN STEAL IT FROM YOUR SAFE IN YOU ROOM!! Oh and we paid cash on arrival for our room  I checked my credit card yesterday to find that the hotel have also taken money off my card..this was on the day before we got there?! I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN SO ANYONE WHO VALUES THERE MONEY  BELONGINGS DO NOT STAY THERE!
Reviews.Author: wkdgirl79

Reviews.Content: their all in on the scam... trust only yourself, we were there for a stag weekend and booked online 18 places in the hotel,As there were only a small selection of rooms, we had to pick carefully who would be in with who, at great length before the stay so everyone would get on.............you know lads. anyway we might as well of not bothered, we had no options but 4 quads and 1 twin.. brilliant, the quads had another bed wedged in a corner! easy money.!.getting back to the main event, the staff know all the scams to make you believe you were drunk or spent more money than you thought,or you never put it in the safe,, did you ? did you ??? did I ?????? the safes go faulty all the time, don't they,, don't they??? well thats the story we all got,and i'm sure we weren't the first and won't be the last to be shafted by the scam which all the hotel staff are in on.. hopefully the higher management will read this and sack the offenders and employ some trustworthy staff which will give this establishment some credibility again. One more thing the cleaner does a good job of cleaning the room but makes sure he moves every piece of clothing before leaving , any notes will be gone in a flash... a perk of the job, he thinks,, i saw alot of screwed up notes in his hand after cleaning a room, he tried to hide them as he walked up the stairs.. a tip you may ask.? your guess is as good as mine from an empty room....? The location was bang on, the staff were cocky. I'm not bitter i just expected the staff to be abit more friendly and helpful.... one last quote from one of the staff as i walked to my room  next you will say you have had 200 euros stolen from you safe!....  make up your own mind.....
Reviews.Author: BarnsleyArchie

Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here Went on a stag do to amsterdam so didnt expect the room to be anything special, which it wasn`t. But my main problem was that when we came in one afternoon to get some money out of our safe it didnt work. After trying the combination 4 times we had to get the man off reception to open it for us, when checking our money then, we had a large amount of euros missing. No one in the hotel seemed to give a toss about this.In the end we went to the police to report it and kept all our money and valubles on us at all times. the man on reception says that your safe codes sometimes expire which i found hard to believe, it was more like they were using the master code to get into your safe then because they dony know your origional code they just put any in and wait for you to go to reception and let them open it. When i went to the police i asked the man on reception for his name to give to the police as a contact, to which he replied no you cant have my name, its nothing to do with me i didnt take your money. Then he proceeded to tell me that noone had taken our money it happened all the time and people just want to claim on their insurance, how i kept my hands off him i`ll never know tosser Very unprofessional to say the least. All in all the trip was very very good but i would never stay in this hotel again unless all the staff which are there now are sacked and some trustworthy people employed there.Swiftys stag do!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Hoylandboy

Reviews.Content: Noise and Sewage!! Upon arrival, after attempting to pay for my stay via my credit card, I was told that the hotel do not take Visa, and in order to pay, the front desk attendant wanted to take my credit card to the hotel next door to make the transaction, which I found extremely odd.The first room we were given had a strong smell of sewage, so we moved to a second room, which was right next to reception. We were kept awake all night by people coming into the hotel and the noisy staff, yelling at guests returning to the hotel to close the front door!Each morning the shower flooded, so that the whole bathroom was covered in 2 of water!This was not a pleasant stay, I would not stay in this hotel again, and I would certainly not recommend it!
Reviews.Author: AColsie

Reviews.Content: To be avoided at all costs! Let me start by saying that I rely on TripAdvisor anytime I travel. I read the reviews and look at pictures posted by travelers (because let's face it...NO property ever looks like the pictures posted by the property!). I usually find that the reviews are split about 50/50 between good and terrible ratings and try to average it out for myself. And then after I stay there...I wonder what some people expect and decide that they are just negative and hard to please people. Still, I have never written a review to TA before to give either a favorable or unfavorable review. This time, I feel obligated to write to save anyone from even considering staying at this place! I feel that listing this property as a hotel is misleading. While some might call those extremely narrow and steep stairs quaint, it should also be considered how one would escape in the event of a fire or other emergency! Speaking of which, the steam from the shower set off the smoke alarm and around 30 minutes later an employee came to see if we were ok. In 30 minutes time, the entire building would have been burnt to the ground! Besides the rodent infestation (seriously...not A mouse...an infestation!), the general cleanliness of our room was even below standard. On our arrival, our non-smoking room smelled of pot smoke...but we thought hey, it's AMS, it's all cool. Then I found a huge tangle of someone else's hair in my bedding! And then there is the shower situation. It is not a stall even...the water just runs out on the floor with no barrier at all. After no sleep at all, I was relieved when my friends said we could leave...at 4 a.m.! We were still charged for all three nights of our original reservation. The fact that management of this property has yet to respond to our request for a refund is the true testament to their concern for the unsuspecting traveler. Even if you must travel on a tight budget, please look at any alternative other than to stay here. You have to trust someone on this...you can trust me!
Reviews.Author: paxtraveler

Reviews.Content: Left at 4am the first night I have stayed in hotels all over the world and on average travel over 50% every year, but never have I had a worse experience at a hotel.As others have said, the stairs are extremely narrow and steep. This was tolerable (even quiant). We reminded ourselves that we were there for the city and not the hotel.Approximately 30 minutes after turning out the lights to go to sleep that first night we heard the rustling of plastic bags and turned on the lights to find several mice crawling around in our purchases of the day. After hiding the bags in our suitcases and calming ourselves, we turned out the lights again and tried to sleep. Almost immediately we heard the mice running around the room again and when my friend reached to turn on the light she startled a mouse that was walking along the headboard of my bed. . . . .the mouse fell on my head.We then left the lights on, but after only 30 minutes the mice returned and began running around the room even with the room fully illuminated. At one point I could see 6 different mice at various spots in the room.At 04h00 we packed everything up and told the night personnel the situation and that we were leaving immediately. He informed us that he was the night attendant and could not do anything, but that he would advise the manager when he arrived later that morning. We moved to a different hotel (Victoria) that thankfully did not require us to share the room with vermin.When I got home, I saw that the Damrak Inn had charged my credit card for the entire 3-night stay. I am still trying to get a response from the management (2 weeks later) to resolve this issue.Yes, it is cheap and the location is great. Please do yourself a favour and spend the extra Euros for nicer hotel. . . . .you deserve it.
Reviews.Author: croooow29

Reviews.Content: Beware with valuables We have just spent 2 days in the Damrak Inn and had a pleasant stay. True the stairs are steep but we all need a bit of exercise. The staff were great. Very welcoming and couldn't do enough for us. The breakfast is basic but does the job. You haven't paid to stay in 5 stars so don't expect it.We had one issue, money went missing from a safe and an expensive cigarette lighter went missing. Also heard other people putting in complaints about things going missing. Just keep all your valuables on your person.
Reviews.Author: ramman66

Reviews.Content: Don't Go There *this is not even a hotel!!!!!!! *there is a recetion desk and rooms that is it!!!*reception staff=plain ignorant*very steep narrow steps throughout...which you have to drag your own suitcase up!*in certain rooms can't close the door of the bathroom when your on the toilet. shower water runs onto the floor and into the room.*there are pigeons in the roof space*************THE WORST POSSIBLE THING WOULD HAVE TO BE THE MICE...ok giving the fact that i am petrified of them but im sure no1 wants to share a room with a rodent!*there were 14 of us male and female and when the boys complain you know its bad!*the only good thing about this ho(S)tel is the location
Reviews.Author: misstoots

Reviews.Content: Greedy Rude and Dishonest I could not get past the booking for this hotel. I made a reservation in April for a stay in November. I used my credit card to guarantee the reservations, not to pay them in advance. In August, a charge for one night's stay appeared. I inquired. Seems that the hotel lost my reservations for November and had me booked for August. When I failed to show up for my fictitious stay, they charged me a 1 night penalty as a 'no show' fee. They were kind enough to admit they made a mistake with my reservations, but wanted to keep my money as advance payment. I asked them for a refund and to just cancel November's reservations because I found a better hotel. The hotel did not respond and did not refund my money. I needed to dispute the charge with my credit card company.
Reviews.Author: HenryLINY

Reviews.Content: Great Location Three of us booked a triple room. Great Location, five minutes from Centraal, one minute from the red light district.Small room  bathroom, but comfortable  clean.The room was right next to reception. Very noisy - bring earplugs!No idea what the breakfast was like, never made it.Overall, good value choice for the budget traveller.
Reviews.Author: FirestarterUKUK

Reviews.Content: Palmed off Arrived to find website booking hadn't been logged in with hotel. who said they always had trouble with this company. Girl behind desk palmed us off with a sister hotel in the centre of the red light area. The sister hotel was a squalid smelly mess and neither hotel could be bothered about us or our predicament. We were fortunate to find a great hotel (See Hotel Citadel review), which catered for our every need.
Reviews.Author: smockford

Reviews.Content: Mice!!!!!!!!! LOCATION: Quite easy to find although we arrived at the damrak hotel only to be sent a few doors down to the damrak inn which is just basically a load of rooms. but excellant location as regards getting around and seeing everythingFOOD: if you want to get your breakfast in the morning or sit at the hotel bar of course your have to go back to the hotel part. we aren't really fans of the continental breakfast so we didn't have breakfast at the hotel.STAFF: staff not very friendly or helpful. if ur on the 1st floor, lucky you! if not be prepared for alot of steep stairs! and for some strange reason the keycards stop working after you take them out of the building so gat them reactivated at reception before you go up al thoses stairs to find you cant get in!ROOMS: the rooms wer fine basic and clean...you get what you pay for! However we did not pay for the company of A MOUSE! this PROBLEMS: honestly the mouse is the only problem that i had with the damrak although friends that we travelled with had problems with mice and pigeons.
Reviews.Author: is_cuma_liom

Reviews.Content: not as awful as people say just back from 2 nights stay at the damrak inn and found it wasnt at all as bad as some reviews make out. after all, it is only a 2 star and probably one of the cheapest in central amsterdam so what would they expect?! my only fault with it are that the rooms are tiny, but the superb location and cleanliness of it made up for that. would recommend the damrak inn to anyone on a budget (it is actually cheaper than most hostels!) and to those who want to be in the centre of it all. ps, shop around for the best prices, i paid 69 euros per night!
Reviews.Author: ali.1978

Reviews.Content: horrible everything if you are over 30 two women over 50 and one daughter over 23. paid in advance and when we arrived.. oh dear...location great, hotel like a flop house. wrote back and forth before we arrived with concerns. great for students or guys...backpackers only.....real narrow. room with fire escape attacked to window and other buildings. not safe. really small. not like photos on websites...would be really really loud. front desk right outside the door to room. we just couldn't stay there. we went and stayed at the Victoria Park PLaza. great everything.. felt safer. loved amsterdam... desk girl smoked right outside of our room. will deal with Odopo regarding complaints.. very hard to carry even an overnight bag up the narrow stairs...
Reviews.Author: ls1314

Reviews.Content: clean and tidy!! stayed here for 2 nights, yes stairs are steep and we were on the top floor but this is amsterdam,the buildings are all the same.Room was small and basic but clean and tidy, the towels werechanged each day.i was more than happy with our stay and would go back as the location was great and so was the price!!!
Reviews.Author: Westontraveller

Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel This hotel is very misleading, first of all the number of stairs upto the Reception were very steep and very difficult to carry luggage up. Then once you were at the reception you then had either one other very steep set of stairs to climb or two if you were really unlucky. We were with parents who cannot climb stairs very well and we were not advised of this. We did view one of the rooms which at 2pm had still not been cleaned despite being advised we could check-in at 1pm!! the rooms were really small, smelt of cannabis and take-away food!!! we took one look and cancelled our booking for the two days, losing our first nights tarrif. We found a hotel just a few hundred yards away which was clean, not that much more money and a whole lot better.
Reviews.Author: springer29

Reviews.Content: do not sray here       our
Reviews.Author: jbarnettparker

Reviews.Content: OK Stayed here for 2 nights at end of december. Ideally situated on Damrak, a few hundred yards from Centraal Station. Small bedroom which had obviously just been redecorated. Spotless bedding and lovely towels. Only downside was spiral-type staircase to reception and then up to room. Unsuitable for those who cannot climb stairs.
Reviews.Author: mammamarg

Reviews.Author: artech
